CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PDCTBT: This is a material name, specifically a polymer named Poly(2,5-bis(3-terthiophenyl-2-thienyl)-1,4-phenylene-vinylene) (PDCTBT).
2. PCDSeBT: This is another material name, specifically a polymer named Poly(2,5-bis(3-selenophenyl-2-thienyl)-1,4-phenylene-vinylene) (PCDSeBT).
3. PCEs: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiencies, but it is often used as a shorthand for the power conversion efficiencies of specific materials or devices.
4. BHJ solar cell: This stands for Bulk Heterojunction solar cell, which is a type of solar cell.
5. PCDTBT and PCDSeBT: These are material names, specifically polymers mentioned in the context of the material design rules.
6. PCDSeBT: This is a material name, specifically a polymer mentioned in the context of the OFETs fabrication.
7. OFETs: This stands for Organic Field Effect Transistors.
8. PCDTBT and PCDSeBT: These are material names, specifically polymers used as the semiconducting layer in the OFETs fabrication.
9. OTS: This stands for Octadecyltrichlorosilane, which is a self-assembled monolayer material used in the substrate preparation for the OFETs fabrication.
10. Si / SiO2 substrates: These are material names, specifically silicon and silicon dioxide used as the substrate material for the OFETs fabrication.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDCTBT
2. PCDSeBT
3. PCDSeBT
4. PCDTBT and PCDSeBT
5. PCDSeBT
6. PCDTBT and PCDSeBT
7. OTS
8. Si / SiO2 substrates

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PDCTBT |
| PCDSeBT |
| PCDSeBT |
| PCDTBT and PCDSeBT |
| PCDSeBT |
| PCDTBT and PCDSeBT |
| OTS |
| Si / SiO2 substrates |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

1. PCDSeBT: A polymer material with selenophene in its backbone.
2. PDCTBT: A polymer material with thiophene in its backbone.
3. fwhm: Full width at half maximum.
4. PCE: Power conversion efficiency.
5. Eg opt: Optical bandgap.
6. HOMO: Highest occupied molecular orbital.
7. LUMO: Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital.
8. Fc / Fc+: Ferrocene - ferrocenium redox couple.
9. PCDTBT and PCDSeBT: Specific polymer materials mentioned in the text.
10. Scharber et al.: Researchers who described material design rules for BHJ solar cells.
11. BHJ solar cell: Bulk heterojunction solar cell.
12. DFT: Density functional theory.
13. OFETs: Organic field-effect transistors.
14. OTS: Octadecyltrichlorosilane.
15. Si / SiO 2 substrates: Silicon/silicon dioxide substrates.
16. SAM: Self-assembled monolayer.
17. HOMO isosurfaces: Surfaces of constant value of the highest occupied molecular orbital.
18. LUMO isosurfaces: Surfaces of constant value of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital.
19. BT accepting core: A specific part of the polymer structure.
20. p - type organic semiconductor: A type of organic semiconductor with p-type charge transport properties.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PCDSeBT, PDCTBT: Polymer materials
2. fwhm: Full width at half maximum
3. HOMO, LUMO: Highest occupied molecular orbital and Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital
4. Eg opt: Optical bandgap
5. PCE: Power conversion efficiency
6. LUMO level: Energy level of the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| full width at half maximum (fwhm) |
| highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) |
| lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) |
| optical bandgap (Eg opt) |
| power conversion efficiency (PCE) |
| LUMO level of PCDSeBT |

Note: The other entities mentioned in the paragraph do not refer to properties of materials, but rather descriptions or context.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: This apparently demonstrates that , in agreement with earlier studies and experimental studies , 17 the replacement of thiophene with selenophene results in a reduction of the optical bandgap due to the increase of quinoid character in the polymer backbone. 18 In a closer look of the film absorptions , it is also found that the full width at half - maximum ( fwhm ) of PCDSeBT ( 155 nm ) is wider than that of PDCTBT ( 140 nm ) , as a matter of a characteristic of strong intermolecular Se°°°Se interactions , which can potentially further increase J SC value. The electrochemical properties of PCDSeBT were investigated by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ). As shown in Figure 1b , PCDSeBT exhibits clear reversible n - doping / dedoping processes in the negative potential range , whereas quasi-reversible p - doping / dedoping behaviors in the positive potential range are observed. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels are estimated to be -5.40 eV and -3.70 eV , respectively , using the ferrocene - ferrocenium ( Fc / Fc+ ) redox couple ( 4.8 eV below the vacuum level ). Both PCDTBT and PCDSeBT have nearly identical HOMO energy levels , but PCDSeBT exhibits 0.10 eV lower - lying LUMO level relative to PCDTBT ( LUMO = -3.60 eV , see also Supporting Information ) , 5a verifying our presumption aforementioned about the effect of selenium on the selective fine - tuning of LUMO level. The material - design rules described by Scharber et al. 19 suggested that the PCEs of a BHJ solar cell should be much more sensitive to changes of the donor LUMO level compared to variations of the donor bandgap. On the basis of the rules , the estimated PCE from the E g opt and the LUMO value of PCDSeBT is 7.8% . This theoretical value is much higher than that of PCDTBT ( 6.5% ) , indicating that a highly promising material for PSCs considering the frontier orbital energies. Upon utilizing a model dimeric system containing methyl groups , the optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT and its frontier molecular orbitals of the calculated HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces were computed by density functional theory ( DFT , B3LYP / 6-31G ) ( Figure 1d ). The HOMO of PCDSeBT is well - distributed along the conjugated chains ; its LUMO is mainly centralized on BT accepting core as shaped by orbital lobes , being predicted a p - type organic semiconductor. In order to corroborate the effect of the heteroatom substitution on charge transporting properties of the polymers , top - contact organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) were fabricated using solution processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT , respectively , as the semiconducting layer on the octadecyltrichlorosilane ( OTS ) self - assembled monolayer (SAM)-modified Si / SiO 2 substrates ( see the detailed devices fabrication in the Experimental Section ).

Let's think step by step.

1. The optical bandgap of PDCTBT is 1.55 eV (unit: electronvolts).
2. The optical bandgap of PCDSeBT is 1.40 eV (unit: electronvolts).
3. The full width at half maximum (fwhm) of PCDSeBT is 155 nm (unit: nanometers).
4. The full width at half maximum of PDCTBT is 140 nm (unit: nanometers).
5. The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT is -5.40 eV (unit: electronvolts).
6. The HOMO energy level of PCDTBT is nearly identical to that of PCDSeBT.
7. The LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT is -3.70 eV (unit: electronvolts).
8. The LUMO energy level of PCDTBT is -3.60 eV (unit: electronvolts).
9. The difference in LUMO energy levels between PCDSeBT and PCDTBT is 0.10 eV (unit: electronvolts).
10. The estimated PCE of PCDSeBT is 7.8% (unit: percentage).
11. The estimated PCE of PCDTBT is 6.5% (unit: percentage).
12. The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT relative to the vacuum level is 4.8 eV below the vacuum level (unit: electronvolts).
13. The LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT relative to the vacuum level is not mentioned in the text.
14. The LUMO energy level of PCDTBT relative to the vacuum level is not mentioned in the text.
15. The optimized molecular geometry of PCDSeBT is computed by DFT (unit: not specified).
16. The frontier molecular orbitals of PCDSeBT are calculated using DFT with B3LYP/6-31G method (unit: not specified).
17. The HOMO and LUMO isosurfaces of PCDSeBT are computed by DFT (unit: not specified).
18. The top-contact organic field-effect transistors (OFETs) are fabricated using solution-processed PCDTBT and PCDSeBT, respectively (unit: not specified).
19. The detailed devices fabrication is mentioned in the Experimental Section (unit: not specified).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. The optical bandgap of PDCTBT is 1.55 eV (unit: electronvolts).
2. The optical bandgap of PCDSeBT is 1.40 eV (unit: electronvolts).
3. The full width at half maximum (fwhm) of PCDSeBT is 155 nm (unit: nanometers).
4. The full width at half maximum of PDCTBT is 140 nm (unit: nanometers).
5. The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT is -5.40 eV (unit: electronvolts).
6. The HOMO energy level of PCDTBT is nearly identical to that of PCDSeBT.
7. The LUMO energy level of PCDSeBT is -3.70 eV (unit: electronvolts).

9. The difference in LUMO energy levels between PCDSeBT and PCDTBT is 0.10 eV (unit: electronvolts).
10. The estimated PCE of PCDSeBT is 7.8% (unit: percentage).
11. The estimated PCE of PCDTBT is 6.5% (unit: percentage).
12. The HOMO energy level of PCDSeBT relative to the vacuum level is 4.8 eV below the vacuum level (unit: electronvolts).
